item.title: New Siggy
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I’ll my usual before I dart off to school

Generally, the signature is good. Not the best I’ve seen, but definitely not the worst. The only thing I would comment on is the render stands out TOO much. I’m pretty sure you made it to stand out, but you went a little overboard

A like the background, although, as .Fusion said, sometimes the little squares don’t fit. In this case, It’s hard. Mainly because sometimes when I look at it it feels that they don’t fit, and sometimes, they do. It’s confusing

The text is, dare I say it, appalling I very much don’t mean to be rude, but I know you can use a better font. Try and stay away from block capitals and bubble writing. I would suggest using a font like this:

That can be found at www.dafont.com

I would also suggest you use a border, but for this signature it isn’t necessary.

Overall - 7/10. Can be improved, but shes good knowledge of ‘special effects’. Try using better fonts in future

Read full topic

item.title: New Siggy
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

As everyone knows I hate those squares people use.

The render blends with the background, very nice. The text, trash it in my opinion. You want something that goes and flows with your signature. That font I can bearly read and you want to pick a color that blends with your signature. Try setting the opacity low and make it white. Try soft light. There are several diffrent ways.

-.Fusion

Read full topic
